summary: |
  Renders a wireframe adornment consisting of one or more lines onto a

description: |
  WireframeHandleAdornment renders a wireframe adornment consisting of one or
  more lines onto a Class.BasePart (including Class.Terrain) or into the
  Class.Workspace. If parented to a player's Class.PlayerGui or the
  Class.CoreGui, this adornment can listen to input events for purposes such
  as making dragger tools.

  Note that a WireframeHandleAdornment instance begins empty and you must
  add lines or paths to it through methods like
  Class.WireframeHandleAdornment:AddLines()|AddLines() or
  Class.WireframeHandleAdornment:AddPath()|AddPath().

  The rendered wireframe can be customized visually through its
  Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Thickness|Thickness,
  Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Color3|Color3, and
  Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Transparency|Transparency properties,
  although these properties only affect subsequent draws and do not update lines
  already drawn into the adornment.

  - WireframeHandleAdornment-Multicolor

methods:
  - name: WireframeHandleAdornment:AddLine
    summary: |
      Adds a line to the wireframe adornment from a starting point to an ending
      point relative to the center of the
      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Adornee|Adornee.
    description: |
      This method adds a line to the wireframe adornment from a starting point
      to an ending point, both defined as a Datatype.Vector3 relative to the
      center of the Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Adornee|Adornee.

      Note that you can make a multicolor wireframe by changing the adornment's
      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Color3|Color3 property before new lines
      are drawn via Class.WireframeHandleAdornment:AddLine()|AddLine(), as
      demonstrated in the following code sample.
    codesamples:
      - WireframeHandleAdornment-Multicolor
    parameters:
      - name: from
        type: Vector3
        default:
        summary: |
          Starting point of the line.
      - name: to
        type: Vector3
        default:
        summary: |
          Ending point of the line.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Unsafe
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - UI
  - name: WireframeHandleAdornment:AddLines
    summary: |
      Adds one or more lines to the wireframe adornment using an array.
    description: |
      This method adds one or more lines of the current
      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Color3|Color3 color to the wireframe
      adornment using an array. Each pair of Datatype.Vector3 points in the
      array acts as a starting point and ending point for a line, relative to
      the center of the Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Adornee|Adornee.

      Note that lines are rendered independently and their ending points are not
      connected to the starting point of any other line. To connect multiple
      line segments in a sequence from point to point, see
      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment:AddPath()|AddPath().
    codesamples:
      - WireframeHandleAdornment-Lines-Array
    parameters:
      - name: points
        type: Array
        default:
        summary: |
          Array of Datatype.Vector3 points in which each pair acts as a
          starting point and ending point for a line.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Unsafe
    capabilities:
      - Basic
      - UI
  - name: WireframeHandleAdornment:AddPath
    summary: |
      Adds multiple line segments to the wireframe adornment in a sequence from
      point to point.
    description: |
      This method adds multiple line segments of the current
      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Color3|Color3 color to the wireframe
      adornment in a sequence from point to point. The path can be closed
      (ending point connected to starting point) by setting the loop parameter
      to true.
    codesamples:
      - WireframeHandleAdornment-Basic-Path
    parameters:
      - name: points
        type: Array
        default:
        summary: |
          Array of Datatype.Vector3 points to connect in sequence with line
          segments.
      - name: loop
        type: boolean
        default:
        summary: |
          Whether the path is closed by connecting its ending point to its
          starting point with an additional line.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Unsafe
    capabilities:

      Adds a text label to the wireframe adornment.

      Class.WireframeHandleAdornment.Adornee|Adornee. You can adjust the size
